extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: WW: Tap to bring one artifact from your graveyard to your hand.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap to prevent up to 2 damage to target artifact creature.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Cannot be blocked by artifact creatures. Any damage Argothian Pixies take from artifact creatures is reduced to 0.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Any damage Argothian Treefolk take from an artifact source is reduced to 0.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Put one counter on Armageddon Clock during each of your upkeeps. At the end of your upkeep, each player takes damage equal to the number of counters on the Clock. Any player may spend 4 during any upkeep to remove a counter.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Counters any artifact as it is being cast.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Artifact Possession does 2 damage to target artifact’s controller each time target artifact is tapped or its activation cost is paid. Has no effect if cast on a continuous artifact.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Target creature cannot be blocked by artifact creatures, and any damage taken from an artifact source is reduced to 0. Target creature is unaffected by any artifact effects that target it.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 0: Sacrifice one of your creatures to add 2 colorless mana to your mana pool. This effect is played as an interrupt. You may not sacrifice a creature that is already on its way to the graveyard.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 2: Give a creature of yours +2/-2 as long as Ashnod’s Battle Gear is tapped. You may choose not to untap Ashnod’s Battle Gear during untap phase.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Target non-artifact creature gains +1/+1 and is now considered an artifact creature, though it retains its original color. Discard Ashnod’s Transmogrant after it is used.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 0: +2/+2 until end of turn. Each time you use this ability, you must choose one of your artifacts in play and place it in the graveyard. This artifact cannot be one that is already on its way to the graveyard, and artifact creatures killed this way may not be regenerated.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Bands, but only when attacking. Any wall blocking Battering Ram is destroyed. Walls destroyed this way deal their damage before dying.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 4: Target any card opponent has in play; remove it and Bronze Tablet from game. You become owner of that card, and your opponent becomes owner of Bronze Tablet. Exchange is permanent; play as interrupt. Opponent can prevent exchange by spending 10 life; this discards Bronze Tablet. Damage-preventing effects cannot counter such loss of life. Bronze Tablet comes into play tapped. Remove this card from deck if not playing for ante.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 2: Prevents all damage against you from any one artifact source. If a source does damage to you more than once in a turn, you must pay 2 each time you want to prevent the damage.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Druid gains a +1/+1 counter each time opponent casts an artifact.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: FlyingPut four +1/+0 counters on Avian. After Avian attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter. During his or her upkeep, controller may buy back lost counters for 1 per counter; this taps Avian.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: TrampleColossus does not untap normally during untap phase; you may spend 9 during your upkeep phase to untap Colossus.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 3: Give target creature +2/+2 until end of turn. Each time you use this ability, you must discard one card at random from your hand. Coral Helm cannot be used if you have no cards in your hand.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Destroy target artifact; artifact creatures may not regenerate. Artifact’s controller gains life points equal to target artifact’s casting cost.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Opponent must discard down to four cards during his or her discard phase.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Players may not untap more than one artifact during each of their own untap phases.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Targets any artifact; X is the casting cost of target artifact. Target artifact is destroyed, and Detonate does X points of damage to artifact’s controller. Artifact creatures destroyed in this manner may not be regenerated.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Take any number of artifacts of your choice from target player’s graveyard and place them on top of that player’s library, in any order.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap during your upkeep to add a permanent +1/+1 counter to any creature. Each time you use this ability, you must choose one of your artifacts in play and place it in the graveyard. This artifact cannot be one that is already on its way to the graveyard, and artifact creatures killed in this way may not be regenerated.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: All artifacts in play now require an upkeep cost of 2 in addition to any other upkeep costs they may have. If the upkeep cost for an artifact is not paid, the artifact must be discarded.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 0: Reshuffle your graveyard into your library. If Feldon’s Cane is used, remove it from the game, returning it to its owner’s deck only when the game is over.

extendedData.name: FlavorText
extendedData.value: Feldon found the first of these canes frozen in the Ronom Glacier

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: The *s below are the number of artifacts opponent has in play.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Sacrifice one of your creatures during your upkeep to destroy any one artifact. You may not sacrifice a creature that is already on its way to the graveyard.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: You may tap Goblin Artisans as you cast an artifact. Then flip a coin; opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in opponent’s favor, your artifact is countered. Otherwise, draw another card from your library. You can only use this ability once for each time you cast an artifact.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 1: All cards from the Antiquities expansion, including Golgothian Sylex, must be discarded from play.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap to deal 1 damage to target flying creature.

extendedData.name: FlavorText
extendedData.value: For years scholars debated whether these were Urza’s or Mishra’s creations. Recent research suggests they were invented by the brothers’ original master, Tocasia, and that both used these devices.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Each time an artifact in play is tapped or its activation cost is paid, Haunting Wind does 1 damage to that artifact’s controller. Is not triggered by continuous artifacts.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: All artifacts in play owned by target player are returned to target player’s hand. Any enchantments on those artifacts are discarded. Cannot be played during the damage-dealing phase of an attack.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: During your upkeep phase, gain 1 life for each card in your hand above four.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 2: Draw a card from your library, then immediately discard a card of your choice to your graveyard.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Unless Martyrs of Korlis is tapped, any damage done to you by artifacts is instead applied to Martyrs of Korlis. You may not take this damage yourself, though you may prevent it if possible. No more than one Bodyguard of your choice can take damage for you in this manner.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 2: Take the top two cards from target player’s library and put them in target player’s graveyard.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: BandsDuring your upkeep, discard one card of your choice from your hand, or Mishra’s War Machine becomes tapped and does 3 points of damage to you.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap to add 3 colorless mana to your mana pool. This mana may only be used to cast artifacts.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 6: Return any of your permanents in play to your hand; enchantments on that permanent are discarded. Can be used only on permanents you cast.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: If Onulet goes to the graveyard, its controller gains 2 life.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap to do 2 points of damage to any target. Each time you use this ability, you must choose one of your artifacts in play and place it in the graveyard. This artifact cannot be one already on its way to the graveyard, and artifact creatures killed this way may not be regenerated.

extendedData.name: FlavorText
extendedData.value: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza’s first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap Gremlins to tap an artifact. As long as Gremlins remain tapped and in play, that artifact does not untap as normal during its controller’s untap phase. You may choose not to untap Gremlins during your untap phase.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: The activation cost of target artifact is reduced by 2. If this would reduce target artifact’s activation cost below 1, target artifact’s activation cost becomes 1. Power Artifact has no effect on artifacts that have no activation cost or whose activation cost is 0.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Gain 1 life whenever one of opponent’s artifacts becomes tapped, or whenever the activation cost of one of opponent’s artifacts is paid. Is not triggered by continuous artifacts.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap to add an amount of black mana equal to target artifact’s casting cost to your mana pool. This effect is played as an interrupt. Target artifact, which must belong to you, is discarded. This artifact cannot be one that is already on its way to the graveyard, and artifact creatures killed this way may not be regenerated.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: When you cast Primal Clay, you must choose whether to make it a 1/6 wall, a 3/3 creature, or a 2/2 flying creature. Primal Clay then remains in this form until altered by another card or removed from play.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 2: Prevent 1 damage to any target. If Rakalite is used, it returns to its owner’s hand at end of turn; all enchantments on Rakalite are then discarded.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Bring one artifact from your graveyard to your hand.

extendedData.name: FlavorText
extendedData.value: Tedious research made the Sages of the College of Lat-Nam adept in repairing broken artifacts.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: All damage done to you so far this turn by artifacts is retroactively added to your life total instead of subtracted. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 2: Do 1 damage to any target. Rocket Launcher may not be used until it begins a turn in play on your side. If it is used, Rocket Launcher is destroyed at end of turn.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap to draw a card from your library. Each time you use this ability, you must choose one of your artifacts in play and place it in the graveyard. This artifact cannot be one that is already on its way to the graveyard, and artifact creatures killed this way may not be regenerated.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: The *s below represent any number from 0 to 6. You set * when Shapeshifter is cast, and you may change it during your upkeep.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: All artifacts in play are discarded.Artifact creatures cannot be regenerated.

extendedData.name: FlavorText
extendedData.value: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers’ handiwork, sparing not a single device.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 3: Target creature loses -2/-0 until end of turn. Creatures with power less than 1 deal no damage.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: If Su-Chi goes to the graveyard, its controller gains 4 colorless mana.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 1: You gain 1 life every time one of your artifacts goes to the graveyard. Can only give 1 life each time an artifact reaches the graveyard.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 3: Select a creature in play; that creature is considered out of play as long as Coffin remains tapped. Hence the creature cannot be the target of spells and cannot receive damage, use special powers, attack, or defend. All counters and enchantments on the creature remain but are also out of play. If Coffin is untapped or removed, creature returns to play tapped. You may choose not to untap Coffin during the untap phase.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 2: Make a creature of power no greater than 2 unblockable by all creatures except artifact creatures until end of turn. Other cards may be used to increase target creature’s power beyond 2 after defense is chosen.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 2: Target creature gains +1/+1 as long as Tawnos’s Weaponry remains tapped. You may choose not to untap Tawnos’s Weaponry during untap phase.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: FlyingTetravus gets three +1/+1 counters when cast. During your upkeep, you may move each of these counters on or off Tetravus. Counters moved off of Tetravus become independent 1/1 flying artifact creatures. If such a creature dies, the counter is removed from play. Such creatures may not have enchantments cast on them, and they do not share any enchantments on Tetravus.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: If opponent has fewer than three cards in hand during his or her upkeep, the Rack does 1 damage to opponent for each card fewer than three.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: All non-creature artifacts in play lose all their usual abilities and become artifact creatures with toughness and power both equal to their casting costs. If Titania’s Song leaves play, artifacts return to normal just before the untap phase of the next turn.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Search through your library for one artifact and immediately place it into play; also, choose any artifact in play that you control and place it in its owner’s graveyard. If the new artifact has a casting cost greater than that of the discarded one, you must pay the difference or Transmute Artifact fails and both artifacts are discarded. Shuffle your library after playing this card.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Triskelion gets three +1/+1 counters when cast. Controller may discard a +1/+1 counter at any time to do 1 damage to any target.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 0: Avenger loses -1/-1 and gains one of your choice of flying, banding, first strike, or trample until end of turn. Attribute losses and ability gains are cumulative.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 1: Any artifact cast by any player gives you 1 life. Can only give 1 life each time an artifact is cast.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: 3: Draw one card from your library every time an artifact of yours goes to the graveyard. Can only let you draw one card per artifact destruction. May not be used when you destroy an artifact to gain benefits from another card.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: First strike, counts as a wall.

extendedData.name: FlavorText
extendedData.value: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging Craw Wurms.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: All attacking creatures lose -1/-0. Creatures with power less than 1 deal no damage.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap to turn target non-creature artifact into an artifact creature with both power and toughness equal to its casting cost. This transformation lasts until your next upkeep; target retains all its original abilities as well.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Flying, first strikeDuring your upkeep, choose one of your artifacts in play and place it in the graveyard, or Yawgmoth Demon becomes tapped and deals 2 points of damage to you. Artifact creatures destroyed this way may not be regenerated.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Attacking does not cause Yotian Soldier to tap.

extendedData.name: FlavorText
extendedData.value: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.

extendedData.name: OracleText
extendedData.value: Tap to add 1 colorless mana to your mana pool or place Strip Mine in your graveyard and destroy one land of your choice.

extendedData.name: FlavorText
extendedData.value: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.
